from pyspark.sql.functions import col, from_json
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType

avro_path_all_partitions = "abfss://eventhublogs@asafirstworkshop.dfs.core.windows.net/synapse-log-hub/synapselogs/"

df_raw = spark.read \
    .format("avro") \
    .option("recursiveFileLookup", "true") \
    .load(avro_path_all_partitions)

# Define expected schema for JSON inside Body
body_schema = StructType([
    StructField("time", StringType()),
    StructField("operationName", StringType()),
    StructField("category", StringType()),
    StructField("resourceId", StringType()),
    StructField("level", StringType()),
    StructField("location", StringType())
])

# Parse the Body column from binary to JSON and extract fields
df_parsed = df_raw.withColumn("log", from_json(col("Body").cast("string"), body_schema))

# Select useful fields
df_clean = df_parsed.select(
    col("log.time").alias("LogTime"),
    col("log.operationName").alias("Operation"),
    col("log.category").alias("Category"),
    col("log.level").alias("Severity"),
    col("log.resourceId").alias("ResourceId"),
    col("log.location").alias("Location")
)

# Show cleaned data
df_clean.show(10)

# Define output path in Blob Storage
parquet_path = "abfss://eventhublogs@asafirstworkshop.dfs.core.windows.net/processed_logs/"

# Save cleaned logs as Parquet files
df_clean.write \
    .format("parquet") \
    .mode("overwrite") \
    .save(parquet_path)

print("âœ… Logs saved as Parquet in Blob Storage")
